I know some people were attached to the highly inefficient (but rather cool looking) Round-8 as a Rocket Fuel container, but I want to post a voice of dissent. I never used the Round-8, ever because the Full/Empty mass ratio was so bad, it never ever helped me. BUT, as a Xenon container it makes great sense, as the variety of Xenon containers is severely lacking.

Before this tuesday's dev notes, I looked at the "Your Least Used Stock Parts" and realised that my most used and most loved part was the Round-8. Seeing how Squad simply now say "Oh, and we're basically removing the Round-8 now and use it for Xenon instead.", doesn't really convince me that they use player opinion as a basis for their decisions. By how they announced this, I'd guess someone just found it more useful at the time while making an ion powered craft and did not think this through...

> 
> Before this tuesday's dev notes, I looked at the "Your Least Used Stock Parts" and realised that my most used and most loved part was the Round-8. Seeing how Squad simply now say "Oh, and we're basically removing the Round-8 now and use it for Xenon instead.", doesn't really convince me that they use player opinion as a basis for their decisions. By how they announced this, I'd guess someone just found it more useful at the time while making an ion powered craft and did not think this through...

Unfortunately, this seems to be Squad's MO. Making a (often major) decision on a whim and then ignoring the community feedback seems to have happened multiple times in my observation, the largest and most glaring example being the infamous 1.0 decision (not to mention Curse, I'm glad to see that the modding community has largely ignored it and created the excellent KerbalStuff instead).

I really hope that Squad listens to the feedback this time (and Harvester gives some kind of apology for his rather slap-in-your-face answer of "mod it back yourself if you don't like it" instead of actually listening to what was being said). There's already enough of a wedge between Squad and the community due to Squad not properly addressing these kinds of issues, I really appreciate what Squad has done in creating KSP but I honestly don't really have much respect for them anymore based on how they've treated the community.

I don't expect them to bend over backwards for the community's every whim, but I do expect them to interact and dialogue with us, especially when making these kinds of decisions (especially when the community voices concerns) and at least explain their reasoning and be open to discussion on the issue even if they still ultimately go with their initial decision. Just ignoring a community breeds all kinds of FUD and speculation that could be largely avoided if Squad were a little more open on their decision making process instead of simply "my way or the highway". That kind of attitude especially doesn't go over well with the tinker mindset that this style of game attracts and is a large portion of the community and playerbase.

It is really easy to mod the part back in. Just go to {directory}\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Squad\Parts\FuelTank\fuelTankToroidal and copy that folder or its contents. Personally, I don't care about the tank, and I doubt new players will be hurt without it. The use I've noticed is that it can stack infinitely within one another, but that is really exploitative.
